phrase.cizu_name: be (或 put oneself) in another person's shoes

jx.jx_en_mean: be (或 put oneself) in another person's situation or predicament
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使处于某人的状况；使陷入某人的处境

lj.lj_ly: if I'd been in your shoes I'd have walked out on him.
lj.lj_ls: 如果我当时处于你这种情况，我早就离开他了。

jx.jx_en_mean: property or a position coveted by a prospective successor but available only on a person's death

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer.). see if the cap fits, wear it (at cap)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美)。 见 （cap条） if the cap fits, wear it

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used in reference to the wear on shoes through walking

lj.lj_ly: you can save on shoe leather by giving us your instructions over the telephone.

phrase.cizu_name: wait for the other shoe to drop

jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)等着下一个事件（或难题）发生

jx.jx_en_mean: The circumstances have been reversed; an unequal relationship has been inverted.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 情况已经逆转；一种不平等的关系已经被倒过来了

phrase.cizu_name: the shoe is on the other foot【非正式用语】

jx.jx_en_mean: To defer action or decision until another matter is finished or resolved.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 推迟行动或决定，直到另一件事情做完或解决

phrase.cizu_name: wait for the other shoe to drop&I{【俚语】}

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English scōh (noun), scōg(e)an (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch schoen and German Schuh

entry.def: Shoes are objects which you wear on your feet. They cover most of your foot and you wear them over socks or stockings.

example.tran: 舒服的低跟鞋子最好了。

entry.def: A shoe is the same as a horseshoe .
When a blacksmith shoes a horse, they fix horseshoes onto its feet.

example.ex: Blacksmiths spent most of their time repairing tools and shoeing horses...
example.tran: 铁匠大部分时间都在修理工具和钉马掌。

example.ex: He helped his father by holding the horses steady while they were being shod.
example.tran: 他父亲给马钉掌时他就帮忙将马抓牢。

entry.def: If you fill someone's shoes or step into their shoes, you take their place by doing the job they were doing.

example.ex: No one has been able to fill his shoes...
example.tran: 目前还没人能接替他的位置。

example.ex: Now that Chris is gone she wants me to step into his shoes.
example.tran: 既然克里斯走了，她就想让我接替他的位置。

entry.def: If you talk about being in someone's shoes, you talk about what you would do or how you would feel if you were in their situation.

example.ex: I wouldn't want to be in his shoes.
example.tran: 我可不想处在他那样的处境。

means.word_mean: 1. footwear shaped to fit the foot (below the ankle) with a flexible upper of leather or plastic and a sole and heel of heavier material
2. (card games) a case from which playing cards are dealt one at a time
3. U-shaped plate nailed to underside of horse's hoof
4. a restraint provided when the brake linings are moved hydraulically against the brake drum to retard the wheel's rotation

auth_sentence.res_content_con: They've embedded an energy harvester in a shoe.

auth_sentence.content: For want of a shoe the horse was lost.
auth_sentence.res_content: For want of a shoe the horse was lost.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For want of a shoe the horse was lost.

auth_sentence.content: A good shoe will lessen the risk of injury.

Sentence.sentence: Buy their own shoes and socks.
Thus, wearing the right brand of clothes or shoes may be of the utmost importance.

sentences.en: She took off her left shoe.
The horse has cast a shoe.
sentences.cn: 这匹马掉了一个马蹄铁。

sentences.en: The accident was caused by worn brake shoes.
sentences.cn: 这事故是因煞车过度磨损而造成的。

sentences.en: A man who shoes horses is called a farrier.
sentences.cn: 为马钉蹄铁的人叫做蹄铁匠。

jushi.english: How much do you charge for mending a pair of shoes?
It was to put the shoe on the other foot.
I'm not afraid of anybody that walks in shoe leather.
